official-title.#text:
To clarify the treatment of health care provider standards of care under Federal health care
			 provisions.

committee-name.#tail: , and in addition to the Committee on the

, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such
			 provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Standard of Care Protection Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Standard of Care Protection Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Rule of construction regarding health care provider standards of care

text.#text:
The development, recognition, or implementation of any guideline or other standard under any
			 Federal health care provision shall not be construed—

to establish the standard of care or duty of care owed by a health care provider to a patient in
			 any medical malpractice or medical product liability action or claim; or

to preempt any standard of care or duty of care, owed by a health care provider to a patient, duly
			 established under State or common law.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
XIX of
			 the Social Security Act

text.#text:
licensed, registered, or certified under Federal or State laws or regulations to provide health
			 care services; or

required to be so licensed, registered, or certified but that is exempted by other statute or
			 regulation.

header.#text: Medical malpractice or medical product liability action or claim

term.#tail:
includes the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, and any other commonwealth, possession, or
			 territory of the United States.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall be construed to preempt any State or common law governing
			 medical professional or medical product liability actions or claims.
